cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 320 mi SE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly northwest across the north-central Bahamas on Friday and forecast to brush or make landfall along the east-central Florida coast Saturday before turning north-northwest inland across Georgia/South Carolina early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast near Port Canaveral

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet northward to the Volusia-Brevard County line, including Port Canaveral
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northwestern Bahamas and the Florida east coast from Jupiter Inlet through Cape Canaveral to Volusia County, then inland toward Georgia and the southeast U.S. coast
weather_observation.wind: Up to tropical-storm-force winds (39–50 mph) possible Saturday with a 44 % chance of sustained 34-kt winds and 11 % chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Significant surge not expected along the east-central Florida coast according to NHC guidance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with localized amounts near 4 inches could cause standing water and minor drainage issues around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and high surf beginning Friday night may disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations.
